title: Advanced Online Simulation-Based Course in Euclidean Geometry

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of basic geometric concepts (points, lines, planes, angles) and trigonometric functions
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative learning using personal devices in BYOD environments, exploring geometric principles in 3D spaces through VR simulations

learning_goals: Learners can three-dimensionally visualize and explain point-line-plane relationships in Euclidean space in a VR environment.
Learners can simulate the process of proving core theorems (e.g., inscribed angle/tangent theorems) using tools like Geometric Sketchpad.
Learners can share and provide feedback on solving complex geometric problems (e.g., polygon construction) with peers using digital collaboration tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
